Sir John Bertram Adams  (24 May 1920 – 3 March 1984) was an English accelerator physicist and administrator.
Adams is known most for his work at CERN and Culham Fusion Laboratory, while never receiving formal university education his helped him stand out after World War II working for organizations like the Telecommunications Research Establishment and the Atomic Energy Research Establishment, eventually giving him the opportunity to serve as acting director and eventually elected director of CERN from 1976 until 1981.
